verses.verse: (1 Sam 12.17) Like snow in summer or rain in harvest, so honor is not fitting for a fool.
(Num 23.8; Deut 23.5) Like a sparrow in its flitting, like a swallow in its flying, an undeserved curse goes nowhere.
(Ps 32.9) A whip for the horse, a bridle for the donkey, and a rod for the back of fools.
(Prov 23.9; 29.9) Do not answer fools according to their folly, lest you be a fool yourself.
(Mt 16.1-4; 21.24-27) Answer fools according to their folly, lest they be wise in their own eyes.
It is like cutting off one’s foot and drinking down violence, to send a message by a fool.
(v 9) The legs of a lame person hang limp; so does a proverb in the mouth of a fool.
(v 1) It is like binding a stone in a sling to give honor to a fool.
(v 7) Like a thornbush brandished by the hand of a drunkard is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.
Like an archer who wounds everybody is one who hires a passing fool or drunkard. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Ex 8.15; 2 Pet 2.22) Like a dog that returns to its vomit is a fool who reverts to his folly.
(v 5|PRO 26:5; Prov 3.7; 29.20) Do you see people wise in their own eyes? There is more hope for fools than for them.
(Prov 22.13) The lazy person says, “There is a lion in the road! There is a lion in the streets!”
As a door turns on its hinges, so does a lazy person in bed.
(Prov 19.24) The lazy person buries a hand in the dish and is too tired to bring it back to the mouth.
The lazy person is wiser in self-esteem than seven who can answer discreetly.
(Prov 3.30) Like someone who takes a passing dog by the ears is one who meddles in the quarrel of another.
(Isa 50.11) Like a maniac who shoots deadly firebrands and arrows,
(Prov 24.28) so is one who deceives a neighbor and says, “I am only joking!”
(Prov 16.28; 22.10) For lack of wood the fire goes out, and where there is no whisperer, quarreling ceases.
(Prov 15.18) As charcoal is to hot embers and wood to fire, so is a quarrelsome person for kindling strife.
(Prov 18.8) The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels; they go down into the inner parts of the body.
Like the glaze (Cn: Heb silver of dross) covering an earthen vessel are smooth (Gk: Heb burning) lips with an evil heart.
(Prov 10.18; 12.20) An enemy dissembles in speaking while harboring deceit within;
(Ps 28.3; Jer 9.8) when an enemy speaks graciously, do not believe it, for there are seven abominations concealed within;
(Mt 23.28; Lk 8.17) though hatred is covered with guile, the enemy’s wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.
(Ps 7.15; Prov 28.10; Eccl 10.8) Whoever digs a pit will fall into it, and a stone will come back on the one who starts it rolling.
(Prov 29.5) A lying tongue hates its victims, and a flattering mouth works ruin.
